item.title: Fist blog post
item.author: robbertjan-1994@hotmail.com (Robbert-Jan 't Hoen)
item.description: Finally, after a few days of troubleshooting, I have succeeded in launching my first website with Hugo! My current setup is GitHub Pages + Hugo + Blogdown as described in this excellent tutorial by Amber Thomas. This allows me to create rich web content by utilizing Rmarkdown files with the blogdown package in Rstudio. This is a R chunk. I can for example add two numbers like this: 1 + 3 ## [1] 4 As this Rmarkdown file is essentially an extended version of markdown it is also still possible to use plain html markup, and create beautiful mathematical equations in LaTeX: \[ e^{\pi i} -1 = 0 \] I chose to use Hugo because I saw that recently many websites had migrated to it.
